mdRecord.dcterms:title: Nellie, Wilt thou be my bride?
Wilt thou be my bride?
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Osborne, Charles. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Song sheet in 2 8-line verses followed by 4 lines repeated from the first verse. Printed in red on p. [1] of a folded sheet of illustrated letter paper; p. [1]-[3] are ruled in blue, but p. [4] is blank. [original]
First lines: Nellie, wilt thou be my bride, and leave a home of gladness ... [original]
An edition published by Firth Pond & Co., c1859, carried statement of responsibility "written and composed by Charles Osborne." Cf. OCLC no. 68891939. [original]
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 1nd 1867. [original]

Hand-colored headpiece features an elaborate floral garland that extends up the left side, across the top and trails off, in black, down the right side. A a vignette of a dancing couple is framed in the garland at upper left. Similar to Magnus 247d, but with a different vignette. A banner above the title reads "Presented to" and can be read as "Presented to Nellie" Cf. Library Company of Philadelphia, American song sheets. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Twentieth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Marriage proposals--Songs and music--Texts
Marriage--Songs and music--Texts
